<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 119, 380, 147]]<|/det|> Cambridge IGCSE™ <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 185]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NAME <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 220, 166, 236]]<|/det|> CENTRE NUMBER <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 213, 424, 261]]<|/det|>
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[891, 279, 905, 294]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[731, 303, 905, 318]]<|/det|> February/March 2025 1 hour 30 minutes <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 327, 395, 344]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 402, 399]]<|/det|> You will need: Geometrical instruments <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 419, 225, 434]]<|/det|> ## INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 431, 294, 459]]<|/det|> - Answer all questions. - Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 462, 808, 479]]<|/det|> - Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. - Write your answer to each question in the space provided. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 495, 482, 510]]<|/det|> - Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid. - Do not write on any bar codes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 526, 551, 543]]<|/det|> - You should use a scientific calculator where appropriate. - You may use tracing paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 558, 469, 575]]<|/det|> - You must show all necessary working clearly. - Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 589, 667, 604]]<|/det|> degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question. - For \(\pi\), use either your calculator value or 3.142. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 649, 214, 664]]<|/det|> INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 665, 388, 682]]<|/det|> - The total mark for this paper is 80. - The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 74, 567, 89]]<|/det|>
List of formulas

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 117, 680, 146]]<|/det|>
Area, \(A\), of triangle, base \(b\), height \(h\). \(A=\frac{1}{2} b h\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 170, 672, 188]]<|/det|>
Area, \(A\), of circle of radius \(r\). \(A=\pi r^{2}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 218, 675, 235]]<|/det|>
Circumference, \(C\), of circle of radius \(r\). \(C=2 \pi r\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 265, 681, 284]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cylinder of radius \(r\), height \(h\). \(A=2 \pi r h\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 312, 543, 333]]<|/det|>
Curved surface area, \(A\), of cone of radius \(r\), sloping edge \(l\). \(A=\pi r l\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 361, 679, 380]]<|/det|>
Surface area, \(A\), of sphere of radius \(r\). \(A=4 \pi r^{2}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 410, 490, 427]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of prism, cross-sectional area \(A\), length \(l\). \(V=A l\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 451, 435, 480]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of pyramid, base area \(A\), height \(h\). \(V=\frac{1}{3} A h\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 505, 424, 524]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of cylinder of radius \(r\), height \(h\). \(V=\pi r^{2} h\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 550, 396, 571]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of cone of radius \(r\), height \(h\). \(V=\frac{1}{3} \pi r^{2} h\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 599, 338, 620]]<|/det|>
Volume, \(V\), of sphere of radius \(r\). \(V=\frac{4}{3} \pi r^{3}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 425, 523, 442]]<|/det|>
(a) (i) Find the actual distance between \(P\) and \(Q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[152, 501, 460, 519]]<|/det|>
(ii) Measure the bearing of \(Q\) from \(P\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 564, 482, 581]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 595, 427, 612]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 74, 535, 91]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[350, 118, 646, 325]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 386, 424, 403]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 572, 407, 588]]<|/det|>
13 Xie changes 2000 dollars into krona.

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[411, 602, 590, 634]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
& 1 \text { dollar }=0.615 \text { euros } \\
& 1 \text { krona }=0.087 \text { euros }
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 648, 631, 665]]<|/det|>
Use the exchange rates to calculate how many krona she receives. Give your answer correct to the nearest krona.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[836, 819, 915, 834]]<|/det|>
krona [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 74, 236, 91]]<|/det|>
14 （a）Factorise．

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[243, 102, 316, 120]]<|/det|>
\[
8 x^{2}-2 x
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 181, 424, 198]]<|/det|>
（b）Expand the brackets and simplify．

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[449, 213, 617, 230]]<|/det|>
\[
5(2 m-1)+3(m+7)
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[83, 351, 521, 368]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 382, 523, 399]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 628, 918, 647]]<|/det|>
